description: From Middle English unthankful, from Old English unþancful, unþancfull, unġeþancfull (“unthankful, ungrateful”), equivalent to un- +‎ thankful. Cognate with Old High German undankfol (“unthankful, ungrateful”).

adjectives.description: unthankful (comparative more unthankful, superlative most unthankful)
